title: Diff. eq.: No context, from slope equation

content.question: Let f be a function with f(1) = 4 such that for all points (x, y) on the graph of f the slope is given by 3x2+1 / 2y. (a) Find the slope of the graph of f at the point where x = 1.

frqParts.text: Let f be a function with f(1) = 4 such that for all points (x, y) on the graph of f the slope is given by 3x2+1 / 2y. (a) Find the slope of the graph of f at the point where x = 1.
(b) Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of f at x = 1 and use it to approximate f(1.2).
(c) Find f(x) by solving the separable differential equation dy/dx = 3x2+1 / 2y with the initial condition f(1) = 4.
(d) Use your solution from part (c) to find f(1.2).

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
